QuoteText: Just because the pregnant mother may not believe in a soul, doesn't mean it doesn't exist.
ResponseText: It is for you and others who believe as you do to demonstrate the existence of the soul if you mean to use is as justification for protecting/giving rights to fetuses.

Sinjin: Sorry my friend, but you have it backwards. It is up to you to prove the non-existence of the soul to justify killing what you claim is only an embryo. Otherwise, nature should be allowed to take its course, which would either lead to a miscarriage, live birth or still birth.

QuoteText: Sinjin: Sorry my friend, but you have it backwards. It is up to you to prove the non-existence of the soul to justify killing what you claim is only an embryo. Otherwise, nature should be allowed to take its course, which would either lead to a miscarriage, live birth or still birth.
ResponseText: Why would the default position favor the actual existence of a theological construct. Tradition? There's not one iota of evidence supporting the existence of such a non-physical entity. Shall we grant leprechauns and unicorns similar reality until disproven?

QuoteText: Chester: You are simply desperate to lump me into your pro-abortion coven, aren't you? Sorry, ain't happening. Your group's usage of the word "choice" is much like Obama's usage of the word "change". Neither of you have exclusive rights to either word. If one side is pro-choice, then the other side must be anti-choice. Not so. If one side is pro-life, then the other must be anti-life. So? Or not so? CHOOSE life. CHANGE Roe vs. Wade .
ResponseText: Nothing in Roe prevents a woman from choosing to carry to term.

babe, It seems clear from this, which you wrote on another thread, that you have placed yourself firmly on the pro-choice side of the issue: I think the decision should be made under conditions where our government makes it easier to get pre-natal care and place babies into the adoption system with less red tape. I think the choice to give life and carry it to term, regardless of how that life came to be (with the exception of rape victims) should become the preferred choice, because it is the right thing to do. Not because God says so, not because pro-lifers say so, but because we all need to be responsible for our actions. Reply With Quote Please note that you, not I, used the word choice twice in the same sentence. BTW, there is no such thing as a "pro-abortion coven".

QuoteText: Sinjin: Is there a law written specifically allowing for the destruction of leprechauns and unicorns? No, there is not. Congress shall make no law .......
ResponseText: Is there a law written specifically allowing the eviction of souls? Exercise of your religious beliefs shall not extend to the womb of others.

QuoteText: Cappy: You may call me pro-lifechoice, if it makes you happy. ;-)
ResponseText: Sorry, but there is no such animal. You're clearly pro-choice. Welcome to the light.
Sounds like the choice offered on early Fords. You could get any color you wished as long as that was black.

QuoteText: Its called *drum roll please!* the brain! More specifically, a mental existence that comes with a brain. If I amputate a hand and keep it alive, does it have a soul? What about a leg? What about a head? If I amputated a head and kept it alive so that it could still talk, think, and feel, is that a person? Someone who is brain dead is legally dead. A mere arrangement of proteins is not what makes us humans unique. Heh, that's a good way of putting it.
ResponseText: You might want to ask archie and the other "ensoulment" folk here which twin gets the soul in the case of identical twins, or does each twin get half a soul?

QuoteText: You might want to ask archie and the other "ensoulment" folk here which twin gets the soul in the case of identical twins, or does each twin get half a soul?
ResponseText: What you guys need to learn is that the soul has a different function than a brain.
